info.name: Greasemonkey button tweak
info.description:
Cleans up Greasemonkey's toolbar button by hiding the actual icon and making the menu drop marker the new icon.

1.0.5/2016-12-19 UPDATE: I've stopped using FXChrome ages ago in favor of Firefox Developer Edition and its theme and this little user style still could. Maybe it's time to drop the theme namedrop. ;) This latest update removes a lot of unnecessary seeming definitions but please do let me know if I broke it for you.
info.additionalInfo:
Change log:

1.0.5/2016-12-19
	Removes a lot of unnecessary seeming definitions but please do let me know if I broke it for you. Also dropped the namedrop from the name.

1.0.4/2011-12-08
	Updated for FXChrome 9

1.0.3/2011-12-02
	Realigned the icon because something changed in FXChrome or Greasemonkey. Didn't investigate further, just fixed it.

1.0.2
	Something minor

1.0.1
	Cleanup

1.0.0
	Initial release


Back story:

When I moved the Stylish and Greasemonkey buttons to a more prominent place on the tab bar instead of hiding them on the menu bar behind an Alt press, I finally got fed up with the inconsistency of the look and feel of my tool button row. I was always right-clicking when I was supposed to left-click and vice versa, clicking the icon when it was the menu drop marker I wanted etc..

Toggling extensions fully off and on is rarely what I want to do. And when I do, the two clicks it takes me to do it from the drop down menu is fine, more appropriate even. That's how it works for Stylish and AdBlock Pro buttons. I tried to search for options and hacks for streamlining the Greasemonkey button similarly but since I couldn't find such within the first 30 seconds, I decided to make my own.
